node.title: 'I want the true story to be told': Inquest into Australia's deadliest aged care COVID outbreak begins
node.alt: Christine Golding  and her mother Efraxia at St Basil's Home for the Aged.
node.description: An inquest into the deaths of 50 residents, at least 45 of whom died with COVID-19, at an aged care home in Melbourne's north begins, with family members telling the coroner of theirÂ "traumatic" and "heartbreaking" experiences.
node.content:
["Senior Victorian health officials were warned about the horrifying conditions at a Melbourne\u00a0nursing home just days after the Commonwealth seized control of the facility, an inquest into Australia's deadliest aged care COVID-19 outbreak has heard.", "The harrowing details have been aired before Victoria's coroner, who is investigating the deaths of 50\u00a0residents, 45 of whom died with COVID-19,\u00a0at St Basil's Homes for the Aged at Fawkner, in Melbourne's north, in July and August last year.", "The first day of the inquest heard that at one point a deceased patient\u00a0was wheeled out in front of other residents, that\u00a0infected residents were mingling with the healthy, bins were overflowing and\u00a0medication was left on the floor.", "Coroner John Cain also heard doctors were shocked by a decision to furlough regular workers as the\u00a0St Basil's crisis spun out of control and warned it\u00a0could have \"disastrous\" consequences.", "Breaches in Victoria's bungled hotel quarantine scheme sparked the state's deadly second wave\u00a0in the second half of 2020, which ultimately swept through the aged care sector.", "More than three quarters of the COVID-19 deaths in Victoria last year were aged care residents.", "
Family of St Basil's residents called police, inquest hears
", "Devastated family members today told the coroner that at one point, they became so desperate for information that they went to St Basil's and began banging on the windows before being threatened by staff.", "\"One of the nurses came out ... and they said\u00a0if you don't stop that, we're going to call the police,\" Christine Golding, whose mother Efraxia Tsalanidis\u00a0was one of the residents who died at St Basil's, said.", "\"I do remember [someone] called the police, the Fawkner police department, and he said our parents are kept prisoner in there,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"I hope this Australian aged care disaster is never allowed to happen again.\"", "", "
Fifty residents died at St Basil's in July and August last year, at least 45 with COVID-19.(ABC News)
", "The coroner was shown a confronting image of Ms Tsalanidis in bed, wearing a white T-shirt and staring into space, taken by Ms Golding through a window.", "\"Her eyes are terrible, lost, awful,\" her daughter told the hearing, saying the experience of her mother's last days were petrifying.", "\"Never in a million centuries did I\u00a0ever think that would be the way I would find my mother, I would get to spend the last moments with my mother,\" she said.", "\"It's been heartbreaking. It's been traumatic.", "\"I want the true story to be told and documented.", "\"Australians deserve to know why our aged care COVID-19 preparedness was so poor, why it spectacularly failed my mother and contributed to her premature death.\"", "", "
Efraxia Tsalanidis died at the St Basil's aged care home in 2020.(Supplied)
", "
Lack of federal-state coordination 'root cause' of tragedy
", "At the start of today's inquest, which will hear from 65 witnesses, Judge\u00a0Cain asked everyone to stand as a sign of respect while the names of the deceased residents were read out in court.", "Judge Cain will investigate how prepared both state and federal health departments were for the outbreak, how it started at St Basil's, the spread of the virus, the decision to furlough staff and how future tragedies could be prevented.\u00a0", "The coroner\u00a0heard that the inquest had recently received an independent report from\u00a0Ian Norton, an expert in disaster and emergency health responses, who found that a lack of coordination between state and federal health departments was a \"root cause of the tragedy at St Basil's\".\u00a0", "The inquest heard that on 21 July 2020, despite the concerns of doctors, staff and the operator of St Basil's, Victoria's Chief Health Officer Brett Sutton furloughed St Basil's staff who were considered close contacts as the catastrophe worsened.", "At the time, 40 residents and 19 staff had tested positive.", "The decision sparked a series of meetings between Victoria's health department, Commonwealth health officials and local medical staff, who called it a \"shocking idea\".", "Peter Rozen QC, who is assisting the coroner, said Commonwealth workers were brought in as replacements.", "\"This was despite all present apparently being aware of a risk that the replacement workforce may be inadequate to meet the statutory care standards,\" Mr Rozen said.", "The coroner heard Australia's Chief Nursing and Midwifery Officer Alison McMillan visited St Basil's on the morning the facility was to be handed over and told Brendan Murphy, the nation's Chief Health Officer, that it was \"fit for purpose\".", "
'Too few' workers to care for patients amid COVID threat
", "But within 48 hours, cracks had appeared.", "In an email to senior Victorian health officials,\u00a0Ellen Maxwell, the medical director at Melbourne Pathology, described what was happening at St Basil's as \"shocking\" and said staff were in tears.", "\"She explained that positive and negative residents were mingling freely; PPE had not been cleared from the last visit; bins were overflowing onto the floor; and medication was on the floor,\" Mr Rozen said.", "\"At this juncture, we merely observe that a number of senior Commonwealth public servants in Canberra, none of whom had set foot in St Basil's,\u00a0were making decisions on 21 July, 2020, about the residents in the teeth of very clear warnings from doctors who were caring for the same residents.\"", "Mr Rozen told the coroner the inquest would not lay blame at the feet of the workers who were brought in to take care of the residents.", "\"There were far too few of these workers at St Basil's for them to have provided care at the level the residents deserved and the law required,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"They were operating within a wholly inadequate governance and management structure trying to look after over 100 frail, elderly people, many of whom were suffering from a deadly and highly infectious disease.\u00a0", "\"If anything, the evidence will reveal that a number of the replacement staff went above and beyond.\"", "The inquest continues."]
